intro: Ardisia escuintlensis, commonly known as the Escuintla beauty, is a species of flowering plant in the family Myrsinaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the tropical regions of Mexico and Guatemala. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and produces small, red berries that are edible. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
